com.company

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the whole world. It constructs the rooms and gives us the ability to get details of a room, check if the player can move into another room, find out if a room exists, retrieve a room.

    This class also allows us to construct any map for the game world.

    The World class has functions to display the nearby rooms in printed format.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeremy Wolff

      • World

        public World(Player gamePlayer)
        Constructor for objects of class World. This constructor calls methods to:
        1. populate the map in the world
        2. populate the items and place them into their appropriate rooms
        Parameters:
        gamePlayer - The player in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumRooms

        public int getNumRooms()
        Allows us to get the total number of rooms in the map.
        Returns:
        the number of rooms in the map.

      • roomExists

        public static boolean roomExists(int row,
                                 int column)
        Search through our map to find a specific room
        Parameters:
        row - row of the room that we're trying to find.
        column - column of the room that we're trying to find.
        Returns:
        true if there is room at the indicated row and column.

      • getRoom

        public static Room getRoom(int row,
                           int column)
        Retrive a room in the map at a specified location
        Parameters:
        row - row of the room being queried
        column - column of the room being queried
        Returns:
        the room that exists at this row and column. returns null if there's no room at this location.

      • getRoom

        public static Room getRoom(java.lang.String name)
        Retrive a room in the map by its name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the room being searched for.
        Returns:
        the room object, if the room exists.

      • getRoomDetails

        public java.lang.String getRoomDetails(Room room)
        Gives the details about a room. This function also adds directions to the nearybyRoomMap.
        Parameters:
        room - a reference to the room that the player is seeking details about.
        Returns:
        a full description of the room and all possible actions directions the player can move

      • placeItemsInRooms

        public static void placeItemsInRooms()
        Go through the items list and place each item into the room associated with that item.

      • printNearbyRoomsMap

        public void printNearbyRoomsMap()
        Print out the nearbyRoomsMap, line by line.
